question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: She can sings well.
She can sing well.
She can singing well.
answer: She can sing well.

question: Which one is correct?
options: I don't like coffee, neither do I.
I don't like coffee, I neither do.
I neither do like coffee.
answer: I don't like coffee, neither do I.

question: Complete the sentence: If I had known, I _____ helped you.
options: will
would
would have
answer: would have

question: Which sentence is in the passive voice?
options: The teacher teaches English.
English is taught by the teacher.
The teacher is teaching English.
answer: English is taught by the teacher.

question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: He told me he will come tomorrow.
He told me he would come tomorrow.
He told me he come tomorrow.
answer: He told me he would come tomorrow.

question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
options: She has been working here since five years.
She has been working here for five years.
She has been working here five years.
answer: She has been working here for five years.

question: Choose the correct form of the verb.
options: She has ran the marathon.
She has run the marathon.
She has running the marathon.
answer: She has run the marathon.

question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: I wish I have a bigger house.
I wish I had a bigger house.
I wish I will have a bigger house.
answer: I wish I had a bigger house.

question: Which one is the correct comparative form?
options: This car is more faster than that one.
This car is more fast than that one.
This car is faster than that one.
answer: This car is faster than that one.

question: Which sentence is correct?
options: Neither he nor his friends is coming.
Neither he nor his friends are coming.
Neither he or his friends is coming.
answer: Neither he nor his friends are coming.

question: Choose the correct sentence with proper tense.
options: They have went to the market.
They have gone to the market.
They have going to the market.
answer: They have gone to the market.

question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: I have seen that movie already.
I seen that movie already.
I have saw that movie already.
answer: I have seen that movie already.

question: Which sentence correctly uses the future perfect tense?
options: By next year, she will have graduated.
By next year, she will graduate.
By next year, she has graduated.
answer: By next year, she will have graduated.

question: Choose the correct sentence with a conditional clause.
options: If it rains, we will cancel the picnic.
If it rains, we cancel the picnic.
If it rains, we canceled the picnic.
answer: If it rains, we will cancel the picnic.

question: Which sentence uses the correct form of the modal verb?
options: You must to finish your work.
You must finish your work.
You must finishing your work.
answer: You must finish your work.

question: Complete the sentence: He behaves as if he _____ the boss.
options: was
were
is
answer: were

question: Choose the sentence with correct subject-verb agreement.
options: Each of the boys have a uniform.
Each of the boys has a uniform.
Each of the boys are having a uniform.
answer: Each of the boys has a uniform.

question: Which sentence is correctly punctuated?
options: After the show, we went out for dinner.
After the show we went out for dinner.
After, the show we went out for dinner.
answer: After the show, we went out for dinner.

question: Complete the sentence: Neither the teacher nor the students _____ ready for the test.
options: is
are
were
answer: are

question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: I can't hardly wait for the concert.
I can hardly wait for the concert.
I cannot hardly wait for the concert.
answer: I can hardly wait for the concert.

question: Which sentence uses an adverb correctly?
options: She sings beautiful.
She sings beautifully.
She sings beauty.
answer: She sings beautifully.

question: Complete the sentence: Hardly _____ I entered the room when the phone rang.
options: had
have
did
answer: had

question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: I look forward to meet you.
I look forward to meeting you.
I look forward for meeting you.
answer: I look forward to meeting you.

question: Which sentence is correct?
options: Between you and I, this is a secret.
Between you and me, this is a secret.
Between you and myself, this is a secret.
answer: Between you and me, this is a secret.

question: Complete the sentence: No sooner _____ he arrived than it started raining.
options: had
has
did
answer: had

question: Choose the correct sentence with indirect speech.
options: He said that he is coming.
He said that he was coming.
He said that he coming.
answer: He said that he was coming.

question: Which sentence is correct?
options: They are planning to visit the museum next week.
They are planning visiting the museum next week.
They is planning to visit the museum next week.
answer: They are planning to visit the museum next week.

question: Complete the sentence: By the time you arrive, we _____ dinner.
options: will have finished
will finish
have finished
answer: will have finished

question: Choose the sentence that uses a gerund correctly.
options: Swimming is fun.
To swim is fun.
Swim is fun.
answer: Swimming is fun.

question: Which sentence correctly uses an infinitive phrase?
options: She wants to travel.
She wants travel.
She wants traveling.
answer: She wants to travel.
